page.title: 15Witherley Hall: the past
page.content:
Witherley Hall is the largest house in the village of Witherley, and possibly stands on the site of the original manor house of the village.
The present Hall was originally the Rectory. After 1886 it became the home of the wealthy land-owning Chamberlayne family, who lived there until the 1920's. The house then lay empty until 1939 when it was taken over for the Army to use. It was used successively to house Dunkirk survivors, soldiers preparing stores for the D-Day landings and Italian and German prisoners-of-war.
Since 1979 the Hall has been lived in by Major and Mrs Aubrey Chalmers, who have undertaken extensive restoration.
